results.title: Making the desert green
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Warren Hall, Warren Brown and Stanley Croner
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how water has helped change the dry salty Coachella Valley in southern California into a rich farming region. It shows how land use has changed, the development of the irrigation system, the movement of water to the farms and how an underground drainage system rids the soil of excess salt.

results.title: Making television
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Adrienne Jones and Cilla Ware
results.brief_description: A behind the scenes view of what is involved in the making of a children’s television program. Students can witness first hand the entire process from the conception of an idea to the end product in production. ‘Making television’ begins with the script writers (Grant Cathro and Lee Pressman) in search of an idea, then follows the process through to rehearsals and conferences. The actors involved discuss their perceptions of the characters they play, and the director gives us an idea of their role in bringing all the disparate elements together at the filming stage. The value of the studio is emphasised while set design and special effects are also explored.

results.title: Making sure-footed friends
results.brief_description: The film shows the design and manufacture of tyres designed for use in Australian conditions. The many safety tests which the tyres are put through before sale are also shown.

results.title: Making shoes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film aims to show school children how shoes are manufactured in a modern American factory. It traces the entire process from cutting the leather, through assembly of the various parts of the shoe, to the final polishing and packing.

results.title: Making sense of it: using your senses
results.brief_description: Two children learn about the ecology of a forest using their senses to identify their environment. Also presents basic information about classification and identification in terms of scientific methods. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Making pottery. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Hartvig Jensen Film Productions and Harvig Jensen
results.brief_description: Shows how raw clay is processed in preparation for modelling. Demonstrations show a jug and a flower pot being made; creative use of engraving and decorating; the final firing and glazing processes.

results.title: Making of the soil
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: This instructional film for farmers and agricultural students, tells of the formation and fertility of the soil, the variety of soils in Britain, and stresses the need for their preservation. By a knowledge of the origin of soil and understanding of its needs, we can preserve and improve its fertility.

results.title: Making of a legend: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: Turner Entertainment, Selznick Properties, L. Jeffrey Selznick and David Hinton
results.brief_description: A feature length documentary which takes a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the 1939 feature film “Gone With the Wind”. Utilises some rare film footage including several screen tests for the part of Scarlett O’Hara, and home movies featuring Vivien Leigh. A fascinating inside view of one of the great accomplishments in motion picture history. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
